intro: Cotoneaster bullatus var. macrophyllus, commonly known as the large-leaf cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features elliptical to ovate leaves that are typically 4–8 cm long and have a glossy upper surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers in the spring, followed by red, fleshy berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its compact growth habit and seasonal color changes make it a versatile addition to landscapes.
